channel.title: RottenTomatoes
channel.description: Rotten Tomatoes Editor-in-Chief Matt Atchity and Senior Editor Grae Drake talk about the latest movies & TV shows, and they’ll tell you what’s Fresh and what’s Rotten, according to the world-famous Tomatometer. The biggest stars and the toughest critics will join them each week to tell you what to see and what to avoid.

item.title: Ep. 146 - Chris Parnell is Top Dog
item.itunes:author: RottenTomatoes
item.itunes:summary: Dr. Spaceman himself Chris Parnell joins the tomatoes to discuss The Peabody and Sherman Show. Before he arrives: The Walk wows Matt and Grae, but the critics aren't feeling the same magic about Pan and Freeheld. Letters from listeners reveal their true feelings on Reality Bites and Peter Capaldi as the new Doctor Who.

item.title: Ep. 145 - Bodice-Ripping Ruminations
item.itunes:author: RottenTomatoes
item.itunes:summary: Matt, Sarah, and Grae take on a passionate advocate for Zack and Miri Make a Porno, Sarah gives some steamy recommendations on shows to watch on Starz, and then you guys really needed to vent about reboots. Hear thoughts on Ghostbusters and Road House...and why Matt and Grae are going to get their asses kicked.

item.title: Ep. 144 - Best TV this week? Plus, Steve Orlando talks Batman & Robin Eternal
item.itunes:author: RottenTomatoes
item.itunes:summary: This week's show is jam-packed with questions, mostly about new fall TV. Matt, Sarah and Ryan weigh in on Fargo, Power, Empire, Blind Spot and more, plus the team discusses whether Viola Davis deserved to win an Emmy of Tatiana Maslany. And in honor of Batman Day, Matt talks to Steve Orlando, writer of Batman & Robin Eternal.

Matt, Sarah and Ryan weigh in on Fargo, Power, Empire, Blind Spot and more, plus the team discusses whether Viola Davis deserved to win an Emmy of Tatiana Maslany. And in honor of Batman Day, Matt talks to Steve Orlando, writer of Batman & Robin Eternal.
item.author: hello@wolfpop.com (Wolfpop)

item.title: Ep. 143 - Dan Harmon answers your questions, plus RT's Emmy Predictions
item.itunes:author: RottenTomatoes
item.itunes:summary: Grae talks to Dan Harmon, creator of Community and co-creator of Rick and Morty. Harmon answers questions from fans, and tackles subjects like working with his partner Rob Schrab, the possibility of a Community movie, and he even addresses the burping in Rick and Morty. Then Sarah weighs in on Emmy predictions for this weekend.

item.title: Ep. 141 - We're Not Scurred of Fear The Walking Dead OR Sucker Punch
item.itunes:author: RottenTomatoes
item.itunes:summary: Last week's Your Opinion Sucks show caused an avalanche of emails about movies and TV shows you love and hate, so we picked the opinions that suck the most to share. We discuss Sucker Punch, House of Sand and Fog, Rick and Morty, and Fear The Walking Dead. Also, prepare yourself for a fan letter to Matt that causes a funky baseline to come out of nowhere.

item.title: Ep. 123 - Six Reasons Age of Ultron is Just Okay & A Visit From Method Man
item.itunes:author: RottenTomatoes
item.itunes:summary: Age of Ultron is a mixed bag, so Matt and Grae take it upon themselves to sort through what works and what doesn't. The emails from the TomatoPatch segment reunite old friends, and make some new ones with keen powers of Star Wars Observation. Finally, The Velvet Smog and Tim sit down with Method Man to talk about why there aren't rap groups anymore, how you can spot him trying to hit his mark in movies, and what recent experience almost gave him a panic attack.

item.title: Ep. 005 - Jared Harris
item.itunes:author: RottenTomatoes
item.itunes:summary: Another giant-size edition! First up, RT editors Sarah Ricard, Ryan Fujitani, and Tim Ryan talk about this week's new movies (The Other Woman, Brick Mansions, and The Quiet Ones). Then Grae and Matt have an extended interview with Mad Men star Jared Harris about his new movie, The Quiet Ones.

item.title: Ep. 001 - Welcome to Rotten Tomatoes!
item.itunes:author: RottenTomatoes
item.itunes:summary: Rotten Tomatoes Editor in Chief Matt Atchity and Senior Editor Grae Drake introduce the Rotten Tomatoes Podcast. They cover what you can expect from upcoming podcasts, and talk about what the critics are saying about Draft Day, Rio 2, Oculus, and Season 4 of Game of Thrones.
